sen.j: 弓道（きゅうどう）は、和弓を用いて矢を射て、的 (弓道)に中（あ）てる一連の所作を通して心身の鍛錬をする日本の武道。
sen.e: "Kyudo" is a Japanese martial art in which the mind and body is trained through a series of conduct of shooting a Japanese bow at a target.

sen.e: Kyudo attracted the attention of foreigners through books such as "Zen in the Art of Archery" (by Eugen Herrigel), in which the focus on spirituality was introduced, and even though it is not an Olympic sport it is enjoyed especially in Europe and the United States with sports associations established.

sen.j: 武士の表芸である弓術は時代の流れに伴い江戸時代末期から明治にかけて大きく変遷を強いられた。
sen.e: Kyujutsu, which was a profession of the samurai, was forced to make a major change with the times from the end of Edo period to Meiji.

sen.j: 江戸末期の文久2年（1862年）、江戸幕府での「弓術上覧の儀」が廃止され、講武所の教科目からも弓術が除外された。
sen.e: At the end of Edo period, in 1862, the 'ceremony of presenting Kyujutsu' at Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was abolished, and Kyujutsu was eliminated from the subjects taught at Kobusho (institute for martial art training).

At the end of the Edo period, in 1862, the 'ceremony of presenting Kyujutsu' at the Edo bakufu (the Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was abolished, and Kyujutsu was eliminated from the subjects taught at Kobusho (institute for martial arts training).

sen.j: 続く慶応3年（1867年）の大政奉還により伝統的な弓術文化は幕藩体制・武士社会の崩壊と共に大きく衰退を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: Then, with the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) in 1867, traditional Kyujutsu culture was forced to decline when the feudal system characteristic of the shogunate, and the samurai society collapsed.

Then, with the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) in 1867, traditional Kyujutsu culture was forced into a decline when the feudal system characteristic of the shogunate and samurai society collapsed.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）には廃藩置県により藩校で行われていた武術教育も姿を消し、弓術に限らず武術全般で実用性が見いだされなくなり、武術衰退に拍車をかけた。
sen.e: In 1871, with the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), martial arts education at hanko (a domain school) disappeared, and practicality was lost not only in Kyujutsu, but in martial arts in general, accelerating the decline of martial arts.

In 1871, with the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), martial arts education at hanko (a domain school) disappeared and its practicality was lost not only in Kyujutsu but in martial arts in general, further accelerating the decline of martial arts.

sen.j: 明治維新以前は、弓を引くことは一部の例外を除いて武士階級のみが許されていたが、維新後は一般庶民でも弓が引けるようになり、急速に遊戯化・娯楽化が進んだ。
sen.e: Until the Meiji Restoration, with some exceptions, only the samurai class was allowed to draw a bow, but after the restoration, the common people were allowed to draw a bow, and it rapidly became a game or amusement.

Until the Meiji Restoration, with some exceptions, only members of the samurai class were allowed to draw bows, but after the restoration the common people were allowed to draw bows, and it rapidly became a game or an amusement.

sen.e: On the other hand, Yumiya (bow and arrow) as a tool for pleasure did already exist among the common people, and gambling archery halls in public resorts were very popular in urban areas after the revolution.

sen.e: Many of the gambling archery halls were entertainment and amusement businesses, and they flourished so much that the Meiji Government enforced restrictions.

sen.j: この様な世相に煽られ公的な弓道場が姿を消していく中、私設弓道場を開くなど弓術古来からの伝統を正しく引き継ごうとする真摯な弓術家の活動により、日本弓道の命脈・伝統文化は保たれていった。
sen.e: While public Kyudo dojo (training hall) disappeared under such social conditions, Japanese Kyudo and its traditional culture survived, thanks to activities by sincere Kyujutsu-ka (those who do Kyujutsu) who worked on properly passing down ancient Kyujutsu traditions by opening private Kyudo dojo, etc.

sen.j: 明治中期に入ると初等教育の開始や徴兵制の徹底、日清戦争・日露戦争での勝利等を背景に、愛国心の高まりと共に社会情勢は国家主義的思想が台頭した。
sen.e: In mid-Meiji, with the beginning of elementary education, full enforcement of conscription, victory in the Japanese-Sino War and Japanese-Russo War, etc., a nationalistic thought rose in the society along with the surge of patriotism.

sen.j: 国策により武道が利用されはじめ、国民は弓道を含めた各種武道・武士道の再認識・尊重をするようになった。
sen.e: Martial arts began being used as national policy, and citizens began re-recognizing and respecting various martial arts including Kyudo and Bushido (the code of the samurai).
Martial arts began being used as national policy, and citizens once again recognized and respected the various martial arts, including Kyudo and Bushido (the code of the samurai).

sen.j: このような社会風潮を受け明治28年（1895年）、京都在住の有識者により各種武道・武術を統括する団体として大日本武徳会が設立され、京都の平安神宮境内に建設された武徳殿を本部とした。
sen.e: Such social trend led to the founding of Dai Nippon Butoku Kai, an organization managing various martial arts, in 1895 by key figures living in Kyoto, and was headquartered in the Butokuden constructed in the precincts of Heian-jingu Shrine in Kyoto.

sen.j: 弓術をはじめとする各武術は、技術を目的とした武術を改め大和心涵養を目的とした武道とし、大正8年（1920年）武術専門学校を武道専門学校と改称。
sen.e: Various martial arts including Kyujutsu shifted from martial arts focusing on technique to martial arts focusing on the cultivation of Japanese spirit, and in 1920, renamed the Bujutsu Senmon Gakko to Budo Senmon Gakko.

sen.j: 武徳会は事業の1つとして各武道の型統一を目指し、剣道では「大日本帝国剣道形」、柔道は「大日本武徳会柔術形」などが制定され、弓道もまた射型統一を行う事になる。
sen.e: The Butoku Kai aimed at the unification of forms in various martial arts as one of their projects, and while 'the Kendo form of the Empire of Japan' for Kendo and 'the Jujutsu form of the Dai Nippon Butokukai' for Judo (Japanese art of self-defense) were established, the shooting forms of Kyudo were set for unification as well.

sen.j: 昭和8年（1933年）5月に開催された全国範士・教士会からの要請を受け、同年9月、当時の武徳会会長鈴木荘六 によって全国から招集された著名弓道家により「弓道形調査委員会」を構成。
sen.e: Based on requests from the national meeting of Hanshi (the top rank) and Kyoshi (prestigious title) held in May 1933, in September of that year, 'kyudo kata (shooting form) research committee' was formed by famous Kyudo-ka who were called from all over the country by the then Chairman of Butoku Kai, Soroku SUZUKI.

sen.j: 武徳会弓道部長 跡部 定次郎が委員長となり、同年11月10日より京都・武徳殿で「統一射法」に向けて3日間にわたる議論が交わされることとなる。
sen.e: Sadajiro ATOBE, the Director of the Kyudo-bu in Butoku Kai became the Chairman of the committee, and discussions for 'the united shooting form' was held for three days from November 10 at the Butokuden in Kyoto.

sen.j: 初日は小笠原流を基本にした巻藁射礼、的前射礼、立射礼の3つの射礼が決定される。
sen.e: On the first day, three Jarai (shooting ceremony), Makiwara-jarai (a way of ceremonial shooting to shoot straw butt), formal shooting facing targets, and formal standing shooting, based on the Ogasawara school were decided.

sen.j: 2日目は射法について審議されるが、「打起し（後述射法八節）」の審議に入るとそれぞれ自己の流派射法から「正面打起し」と「斜面打起し」を主張し合い、互いに譲らず喧々囂々白熱した議論へと発展、その日は議論の決着を見ずに終了した。
sen.e: On the second day, shooting forms were discussed, but when 'Uchiokoshi (anchoring) (mentioned later in Shaho hassetsu)' was discussed, they each advocated their own school's shooting forms, 'Shomen-uchiokoshi' or 'Shamen-uchiokoshi (anchoring in slanting position)' and would not give in, leading to a hotly debate, ending the day without a conclusion.

sen.j: 最終日、議論はほとんど決裂の様相を呈していたが、九州の祝部範士から出された妥協案「正面打起し・斜面打起しの中間的方法」を採用する事で一同は賛成を表明、これで一応の決定を得た。
sen.e: On the final day, the discussion seemed to break down, all agreed on adopting a compromise proposal of 'an intermediate method for Shomen-uchiokoshi and Shamen-uchiokoshi' presented by Hanshi Noribe, and a tentative decision was made.

sen.j: 昭和9年（1934年）11月、これを持って「弓道要則」とし統一射法として正式に制定。
sen.e: In November 1934, this was named 'Kyudo-yosoku' (basic arts of shooting an arrow) and was officially established as the united shooting form.

sen.j: 武徳会は全国に普及、徹底させようとするも、この「中間的妥協案」には弓道界から賛否続出、雑誌・新聞紙上で大論争が展開され、ついには「鵺（ぬえ）的射法」と揶揄されるまでに至る。
sen.e: Butoku Kai tried to spread and enforce it nationwide, but this 'intermediate compromise' raised many opinions for and against it from the Kyudo world, and major debate grew in magazines and newspapers, eventually mocking it a 'Nue-mato shaho' (slippery art of shooting an arrow).

sen.j: 昭和12年（1937年）日中戦争勃発、翌年の昭和13年（1938年）「国家総動員法」公布。
sen.e: In 1937, Sino-Japanese war erupted, and in the following 1938, 'National General Mobilization Act' was issued.

sen.j: 武道は政府・武道団体幹部によって「国力増強・国威発揚」を狙って次第に政府管理下に組み込まれ始め、そして利用されてゆく。
sen.e: Martial arts began gradually being incorporated under government management for 'enhancement of the national strength and enhancement of the national prestige,' and is put to use.

sen.j: 昭和16年（1941年）太平洋戦争勃発、同年政府機関による議論の末、厚生・文部・陸軍・海軍・内務の5省共管による政府の外郭団体とした新たな武道統括団体の新設。
sen.e: The Pacific War erupted in 1941, and as a result of discussions by government agencies, a new management organization for martial arts was newly established that year as an extra-departmental organization of the government, co-managed by five ministries, Health and Welfare, Education, Army, Navy, and Interior.

sen.j: 既存の武徳会はこれに包含される形でこの武道団体に改組・帰一される事となる。
sen.e: The existing Butoku Kai was reorganized and united into this martial arts organization, to be subsumed under it.

sen.j: 翌昭和17年（1942年）、既存の武徳会は改組され会長に東條英機内閣総理大臣、副会長に厚生省・文部省・陸軍省・海軍省・内務省 (日本)の各大臣と学識経験者1名をそれぞれ招き、理事長に民間人、各支部長には各地の知事をあてた。
sen.e: In 1942, the existing Butoku Kai was reorganized with Prime Minister, Hideki TOJO, as Chairman, the ministers of the Ministry of Health and Welfare, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Army, Ministry of the Navy, and Ministry of Interior and an academic expert as Vice-chairmen, a private citizen as Administrative Director, and governors of the region as head of the branches.

sen.j: 本部は京都の武徳殿から東京の厚生省内に移転、こうして政府5省が共管する政府の外郭団体として新たな大日本武徳会が発足する。
sen.e: The headquarter was transferred from the Butokuden in Kyoto to the Ministry of Health and Welfare in Tokyo, and thus, a new Dai Nippon Butoku Kai was established as an extra-departmental organization of the government, co-managed by five government ministries.

sen.j: 昭和18年（1943年）3月、新武徳会は称号を範士・達士・錬士とし、段位を等位制に改め、初段を五等、二段を四等～五段を一等として、六段以上の段位を廃止。
sen.e: In March 1943, the new Butoku Kai changed the titles to Hanshi, Tasshi, and Renshi (Senior Teacher), and the dan-i (qualification of rank) to a to-i system, with the fifth to as the first dan level, fourth to as the second dan level, and so on to the first to as the fifth dan, abolishing the sixth dan and higher dan-i.

sen.e: After the war, due to a backlash against the rigorous enforcement of martial arts from before the war to during the war which was almost like a national policy, people's feelings towards martial arts became very harsh.

sen.e: When the World War II ended, Butoku Kai tried to immediately change its existing nature to a private organization, and privatized its operation in January 1946.

sen.e: They presented a report to the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers as of September 28, 1946, and announced a voluntary dissolution on October 31, bringing an end to the fifty two-year history of Butoku Kai.

sen.e: However, the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers did not accept the voluntary dissolution of Butoku Kai, and ordered dissolution of the Butoku Kai on November 9, expelling around 5,000 people from the public and private sectors who were involved in Butoku Kai.

sen.e: When the state of society settled in 1954, the Dai Nippon Butoku Kai reestablishment movement which occurred in 1952 became active again, and became an issue within the Kyudo federation as well.

sen.e: However, the Ministry of Education, after careful discussions rejected the request for establishment of Butoku Kai in August 1955, on account of the existence of a national organization democratically organized and operating soundly, and which was also a member of the Japan Amateur Sports Association.

sen.e: In the 'Textbook of Archery,' Shaho hassetsu was defined, and the united uchiokoshi (intermediate uchiokoshi) in the 'Kyudo-yosoku' which was established in the Dai Nippon Butoku Kai was officially abolished, to adopt the Shomen and Shamen uchiokoshi methods.

sen.j: 昭和20年（1945年）11月・12月、文部省発体80号・100号により、学校における武道（剣道・柔道・薙刀・弓道）の授業は全面的に禁止され、課外の部活動も禁止された。
sen.e: In November and December of 1945, martial art (Kendo, Judo, naginata (Japanese halberd), Kyudo) classes in schools were fully prohibited by Ministry of Education, Physical development Issue 80 and Issue 100, and extracurricular club activities were also prohibited.
sen.cmt: 「文部省発体」の「発体」については、下記サイトの「発学」「発社」「発秘」「発宗」などと同様の何らかの略かと思われますが、具体的な意味はわかりませんでした。（仮にPhysical developmentと訳しました）。

sen.j: 文部省は学校教育における戦時色の払拭に努め、武道の免許状も無効扱いとされ、「武道」という言葉自体に軍事的な意味合いを含むとして使用は控えられた。
sen.e: The Ministry of Education attempted to cast aside anything of a wartime nature from school education, treating martial arts licenses as void, and avoiding the use of the term 'martial arts' claiming that it contained some military meaning.

sen.e: Later, on July 25, 1951, in response to a notice of Administrative Vice-Minister of Education, Kyudo was approved as a tool for physical education in junior high school and above, permitted to be used again in school education, and the ban on extracurricular club activities was also lifted.

sen.j: 「射法八節」の中で流派技術であったり、日本弓術の伝統的技術体系である歩射・騎射・堂射の技術が入り乱れるなど、射手や指導者によって技術の取捨選択が成され、現在では多くの射手はそれぞれの技術が入り交じった「射法」を行っているのが現状である。
sen.e: Techniques of the schools and techniques from traditional technical systems in Japanese Kyudo such as Busha, Kisha, and Dosha were mixed together in the 'Shaho hassetsu,' and techniques were sorted out by archers and instructors, resulting in many archers today following the 'shooting form' which is a mixture of these techniques.

tit.j: アーチェリーとの比較

sen.j: アーチェリー（洋弓）はかつて全日本弓道連盟が「洋弓部」として管轄し、1958年には国際アーチェリー連盟（FITA）に加盟した。
sen.e: Archery (Yokyu (Western-style archery)) was once under the jurisdiction of the All Nippon Kyudo Federation as 'Yokyu division,' and it became a member of the Fédération Internationale de Tir à l'Arc (FITA) in 1958.

Archery (Yokyu (Western-style archery)) was once under the jurisdiction of the All Nippon Kyudo Federation as the 'Yokyu Division,' and in 1958 it became a member of the Fédération Internationale de Tir à l'Arc (FITA).

Archery (Yokyu (Western-style archery)) was once under the jurisdiction of the All Nippon Kyudo Federation as the 'Yokyu Division,' and in 1958 it became a member of the Fédération Internationale de Tir à l'Arc (FITA).

sen.j: しかし国内のアーチェリー団体からの要請や、1967年の第24回世界選手権に出場した和弓選手の惨敗などを受けて、1968年にFITA加盟権を全日本アーチェリー連盟に移譲し、洋弓への関与を終えた。
sen.e: However, upon requests from domestic archery organizations, and the crushing defeat of the archers of Japanese bow who participated in the 24th world championship in 1967, they transferred the FITA membership to the All Japan Archery Federation in 1968, and ended their involvement in Yokyu.

However, upon requests from domestic archery organizations, and due to the crushing defeat of the archers of Japanese bow who participated in the 24th world championship in 1967, they transferred the FITA membership to the All Japan Archery Federation in 1968 and ended their involvement in Yokyu.

sen.j: 技術的には、アーチェリーは矢を（身体から見て）弓の左に番え、弦は右手人差し指、中指、薬指で引く「地中海式」をとるのに対し、弓道は矢を弓の右に番え、取り掛けは右手親指根で弦を引っ掛けるようにして保持する「蒙古式（モンゴル式）」をとる（弓術諸外国弓術との比較）。
sen.e: Technically, archery uses the 'Mediterranean style' where the arrow is fixed on the left side of the bow (viewed from the body) and the string is drawn with the index finger, middle finger, and the third finger of the right hand, while Kyudo uses the 'Menggu (Mongol) style' where the arrow is fixed on the right side of the bow and torikake (gripping of the bowstring with the right hand) is maintained by hooking the string with the base of the right thumb (Comparison with archery of foreign countries in Kyujutsu).

Technically, archery uses the 'Mediterranean style,' in which the arrow is fixed on the left side of the bow (as viewed from the body) and the string is drawn with the index, middle and third fingers of the right hand, while Kyudo uses the 'Menggu (Mongol) style,' in which the arrow is fixed on the right side of the bow and torikake (gripping of the bowstring with the right hand) is maintained by hooking the string with the base of the right thumb (see the comparison with archery of foreign countries in Kyujutsu).
